Job Position: Content Creator / Social Media Manager

Job Location: Gwarimpa, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Fashion / Retail

About the Role


	We seek a creative and trend-savvy Content Creator / Social Media Manager to grow the brand’s online presence, engage its audience, and bring fresh, viral ideas to life.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Communications Manager",
  "description": "TechnoServe works with enterprising people in the developing world to build competitive farms, businesses, and industries. We are a non-profit organization that develops business solutions to poverty by linking people to information, capital, and markets. Our work is rooted in the idea that given the opportunity, hardworking men and women in even the poorest places can generate income, jobs, and wealth for their families and communities. With more than four decades of proven results, we believe in the power of private enterprise to transform lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Communications Manager - Nigeria

Requisition number: COMMU005176
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Job type:&nbsp;Full-time
Work mode:&nbsp;On-site
Travel: Travel up to 60%
Job category: Programs
Reporting/Supervisor: Country Director

Job Summary


	Reporting to the Country Director, the Communications Manager will lead and implement key communications initiatives for various projects across TechnoServe&rsquo;s Nigeria platform.
	This role&rsquo;s primary responsibility will be developing and advancing the communications strategy for the Plastics Recycling Program in Nigeria (PreP), a circular economy initiative that engages&nbsp; a wide network of partners, beneficiaries, and public and private sector audiences.
	The role will also support communications for several additional projects in the agri-food and entrepreneurship sectors. Across this portfolio, the Communications Manager will effectively engage with media, partners, staff members, and other stakeholders.
	This role requires excellent written and oral communications skills, the ability to set priorities, efficiently manage time and multiple complex tasks, and work independently.


Country and Program Overview


	TechnoServe brings more than a decade of experience designing and implementing market-led interventions in Nigeria to address the country&rsquo;s development challenges. Working in most of Nigeria&rsquo;s 36 states, TechnoServe is partnering with a variety of public and private funders in agriculture and enterprise development.
	Nigeria&rsquo;s 200 million population generates an estimated 32 million metric tons of waste annually, with plastic accounting for 2.5 million metric tons. In 2024, TechnoServe and the Coca-Cola Foundation launched the Plastics Recycling Program in Southern Nigeria (PReP) program in Lagos and Anambra. Building on the successes of PReP, the project is expanding to PReP 2.0, now encompassing an additional location: Kano State.
	The objective of the project is to reduce plastic waste by increasing the volume and quality of recycled PET plastics.
	This objective will be achieved through inclusive, market-driven interventions along the value chain and an enabling environment that will improve the competitiveness, sustainability, and profitability of collectors, aggregators, and recyclers.&nbsp;


Primary Functions &amp; Responsibilities


	Lead the development and execution of PRePs integrated communications strategy with support from the TechnoServe global communications department and the project&#39;s leadership team.
	Produce high-quality content for print and online channels, including articles, press releases, human-interest stories, blogs, case studies, and social media, fact sheets, and other materials.
	Coordinate with appropriate media outlets to obtain news coverage.
	Provide design and creative services support.
	Plan and coordinate key project events and develop materials for them.
	Support the development of project presentations, videos, and training materials.
	Coordinate with HQ to develop and maintain project communication materials, including contributing to the digital assets management system.
	Review external communications to ensure they are consistent with project messaging and communications guidelines and donor co-branding rules.
	Develop staff capacity and coordinate with field staff to collect success stories and photos.

Communications Manager Job at TechnoServe




        
    

        
        TechnoServe works with enterprising people in the developing world to build competitive farms, businesses, and industries. We are a non-profit organization that develops business solutions to poverty by linking people to information, capital, and markets. Our work is rooted in the idea that given the opportunity, hardworking men and women in even the poorest places can generate income, jobs, and wealth for their families and communities. With more than four decades of proven results, we believe in the power of private enterprise to transform lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Communications Manager - Nigeria
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Requisition number: COMMU005176
Job Location: Abuja
Job type: Full-time
Work mode: On-site
Travel: Travel up to 60%
Job category: Programs
Reporting/Supervisor: Country Director

Job Summary


	Reporting to the Country Director, the Communications Manager will lead and implement key communications initiatives for various projects across TechnoServe’s Nigeria platform.
	This role’s primary responsibility will be developing and advancing the communications strategy for the Plastics Recycling Program in Nigeria (PreP), a circular economy initiative that engages  a wide network of partners, beneficiaries, and public and private sector audiences.
	The role will also support communications for several additional projects in the agri-food and entrepreneurship sectors. Across this portfolio, the Communications Manager will effectively engage with media, partners, staff members, and other stakeholders.
	This role requires excellent written and oral communications skills, the ability to set priorities, efficiently manage time and multiple complex tasks, and work independently.


Country and Program Overview


	TechnoServe brings more than a decade of experience designing and implementing market-led interventions in Nigeria to address the country’s development challenges. Working in most of Nigeria’s 36 states, TechnoServe is partnering with a variety of public and private funders in agriculture and enterprise development.
	Nigeria’s 200 million population generates an estimated 32 million metric tons of waste annually, with plastic accounting for 2.5 million metric tons. In 2024, TechnoServe and the Coca-Cola Foundation launched the Plastics Recycling Program in Southern Nigeria (PReP) program in Lagos and Anambra. Building on the successes of PReP, the project is expanding to PReP 2.0, now encompassing an additional location: Kano State.
	The objective of the project is to reduce plastic waste by increasing the volume and quality of recycled PET plastics.
	This objective will be achieved through inclusive, market-driven interventions along the value chain and an enabling environment that will improve the competitiveness, sustainability, and profitability of collectors, aggregators, and recyclers. 


Primary Functions & Responsibilities


	Lead the development and execution of PRePs integrated communications strategy with support from the TechnoServe global communications department and the project's leadership team.
	Produce high-quality content for print and online channels, including articles, press releases, human-interest stories, blogs, case studies, and social media, fact sheets, and other materials.
	Coordinate with appropriate media outlets to obtain news coverage.
	Provide design and creative services support.
	Plan and coordinate key project events and develop materials for them.
	Support the development of project presentations, videos, and training materials.
	Coordinate with HQ to develop and maintain project communication materials, including contributing to the digital assets management system.
	Review external communications to ensure they are consistent with project messaging and communications guidelines and donor co-branding rules.
	Develop staff capacity and coordinate with field staff to collect success stories and photos.
	Support project staff and project contractors/vendors to produce high-quality communications materials consistent with project-specific identity and communications guidelines.
	Identify key milestones and opportunities to share achievements and learnings at a global level, in collaboration with TechnoServe's global communications team.
	Support project reporting and translation, as needed.
	Build and maintain an appropriate, collaborative working relationship with primary donor counterparts
	Other tasks as assigned by the supervisor.


Supervisory Responsibilities:


	Senior Communications Specialist


Basic Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree + 7 years of relevant experience in PR, journalism, communications or marketing OR Master’s Degree + 5 years relevant work experience
	Superior writing skills, including ability to synthesize research materials into simple, clear language


Preferred Qualifications:


	Solid understanding of the local media landscape in Nigeria and major international development businesses.
	Experience with CMS, such as WordPress.
	Deep interest in, and knowledge of, international development, the circular economy, and/or international business
	Knowledge of and appreciation for TechnoServe’s mission and solutions


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


	People and project management skills
	Proficiency with Google Workspace and Microsoft Office tools
	Video production and/or photography experience, familiarity with Canva, Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator a plus.
	Required Languages: Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal skills, including fluency in English. Knowledge of local languages is a plus.


Note


	We encourage all qualified individuals who share TechnoServe's vision of improving the lives of others through proven business solutions to apply.
	With our commitment to diversity, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and affirmative action employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, HIV/AIDS status, protected veteran status, disability and all other protected classes.
	We are also proud of our commitment to protecting staff, partners, and beneficiaries from abuse and exploitation and thoroughly vet all final candidates through rigorous background and reference checks
